greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of Motzkin paths of length n and height k (n>=0, k>=0).
comment: Row sums are the Motzkin numbers (A001006).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
Richard J. Mathar, Motzkin Islands: a 3-dimensional Embedding of Motzkin Paths, viXra:2009.0152, 2020.
formula: The g.f. for column k is z^(2k)/[P_k*P_{k+1}], where the polynomials P_k are defined by P_0=1, P_1=1-z, P_k=(1-z)P_{k-1}-z^2*P_{k-2}.
Sum_{k=1..floor(n/2)} k * T(n,k) =  A333498(n). - _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 28 2020
example: T(5,2) = 5 counts HUUDD, UUDDH, UUDHD, UHUDD and UUHDD, where U=(1,1), H=(1,0) and D=(1,-1).
maple: P[0]:=1: P[1]:=1-z: for n from 2 to 10 do P[n]:=sort(expand((1-z)*P[n-1]-z^2*P[n-2])) od: for k from 0 to 8 do h[k]:=series(z^(2*k)/P[k]/P[k+1],z=0,20) od: a:=proc(n,k) if k=0 then 1 elif n=0 then 0 else coeff(h[k],z^n) fi end: seq(seq(a(n,k),k=0..floor(n/2)),n=0..15);
b:= proc(x, y, h) option remember; `if`(x=0, z^h, add(
b(x-1, y+j, max(h, y)), j=-min(1, y)..min(1, x-y-1)))
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, z, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(n, 0$2)):
seq(T(n), n=0..16);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 13 2017, revised Mar 28 2020
mathematica: T[n_] := Function[p, Table[Coefficient[p, z, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, z]}]][ b[n, 0, 0]];
Table[T[n], {n, 0, 16}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 12 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Sep 01 2004
